meanings.sent1: The children at the party were the jolliest bunch, laughing and playing together.
meanings.sent2: During the holiday season, everyone seems to be in their jolliest mood, spreading cheer around.
meanings.sent3: The jolliest clown at the circus made everyone burst into laughter with his silly antics.
meanings.sent4: Her jolliest memories were of dancing in the rain, carefree and happy.
meanings.sent5: The jolliest sunflower in the garden stood tall and bright, bringing joy to all who passed by.

meanings.definition: Showing or engaging in good humor
meanings.sent1: Grandpa told the jolliest jokes that always made us giggle uncontrollably.
meanings.sent2: The comedian had the jolliest demeanor on stage, making the audience roar with laughter.
meanings.sent3: The jolliest puppy in the litter wagged its tail happily, bringing smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: Her jolliest friend was always there to lift her spirits with a funny story or a kind word.
meanings.sent5: The jolliest painting in the gallery seemed to wink at visitors, inviting them to enjoy its humor.
